fact_check_explanation_title: The BBC did use old footage of Boris Johnson laying a Remembrance Wreath
fact_check_explanation_summary: Excerpt The footage is from the 2016 Remembrance Sunday service. The BBC says it was a production error.

fact_check_explanation_title: Cambridge University has not banned poppies
fact_check_explanation_summary: The student union confirmed that a vote last year had been misinterpreted by the press.

fact_check_explanation_title: Spending on services for young people in England has fallen since 2010
fact_check_explanation_summary: The English budget for children and young people is down 13% in real terms, while spending on youth services specifically has fallen by 73%.

fact_check_explanation_title: No indication that the European Court of Justice would be the arbiter of all disputes in a future UK-EU trade agreement
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK and EU’s mutually agreed intention is that the EU courts would only be the ultimate arbiter of disputes which relate to the interpretation of EU law.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is not an image of Jeremy Corbyn at an IRA funeral
fact_check_explanation_summary: The man in the photos has been identified by those familiar with Bobby Sands as Jim Gibney, who now serves as a political aide.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police officer numbers in England and Wales
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number of police officers has dropped by 20,600 since 2010.

fact_check_explanation_title: Paying £500 million more a week for drugs post-Brexit is based on a fairly extreme scenario
fact_check_explanation_summary: While it’s certainly possible the NHS could pay more for drugs after a post-Brexit US trade deal, we can’t say what this would look like until after a draft agreement …

fact_check_explanation_title: John McDonnell repeats misleading claim about Conservative pension age plans
fact_check_explanation_summary: The recommendation to raise the pension age to 75 comes from the Centre for Social Justice think tank. There’s no evidence that it’s Conservative Party policy.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ken Clarke did not say he won’t vote for the Conservatives
fact_check_explanation_summary: He did say there was a possibility that he might not, but that he didn’t expect this to be the case.

fact_check_explanation_title: This video has been edited to make Keir Starmer appear confused at the end
fact_check_explanation_summary: In the original video, Mr Starmer promptly answers Piers Morgan’s question.

fact_check_explanation_title: £50 billion “remain bonus” figure is a reasonable estimate but highly uncertain
fact_check_explanation_summary: The calculation is a fair assessment of the best available forecasts. But those forecasts themselves contain a high degree of uncertainty.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lib Dem leaflet falsely attributes pro-Lib Dem quote to the Guardian
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Lib Dem leaflet edited a Guardian headline, which paraphrased the words of Jo Swinson, to make it look like the Guardian said it directly.
